borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The bulk, mass, scale and sitting of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearing and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, particularly no.11 and no.15 St John's Road. Infilling the gap and generates an overbearing impact to the shared boundaries and introduces a material loss of outlook, daylight and sunlight to the adjacent dwellings.  The depth of the extension disrupts the symmetry of the dwellings whilst introducing a significant mass and bulk to the rear of the dwelling therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The bulk, mass, scale and sitting of the proposed development presents an insubordinate addition to the dwelling and does not sympathise with the built form of the terrace.  The proposed extension would infill the prominent gaps between the dwellings. Officers consider the closing of the gap to be unacceptable to the built form of the terrace which introduces a disbalance to the terrace row, whilst creating a large mass and bulk to the boundary of the site. The proposal is disproportionate to the original dwelling and doubles the depth which is unacceptable As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension and remove window and install door with Juliet  Balcony on first floor rear elevation.
